abstract.para: This manual documents the workings and usage of MaNGOS, a free reference implementation of a MMORPG server system.

sect1.title: Introduction
sect1.para: MaNGOS is the abbreviation for Massive Network Game Object Server. It is a collection of daemons and tools required to build a large scale online gaming platform, for games know as MMORPG. It's not a fixed system where you can only play one kind of MMORPG but nearly any kind of MMORPG as MaNGOS only provides a foundation of tools and daemons required to build such services. We do include sample game services for well known MMORPGs' available, but we as well include everything you need to create a new gaming daemon for your own MMORPG.

The main terms describing MaNGOS are "object orientation" and "automation". MaNGOS' goal is to provide a strong and complete framework for the development of large scale MMORPG services on multiple platforms, and aims to provide learning developers with a reference implementation for professional software development.

Developers will enjoy the possibilities to define custom communication schemes for their own game client, as well as the abilitiy to use various backends for authentication, as well as for identification of access control rights.

On a higher level, MaNGOS allows users - read MMORPG content developers - to create and define custom game content, including basic objects, characters, and everything you might think of. The only limits are your own imagination.
